description:
The main reason they exist is for Lottie compatibility but they add a bunch of restrictions.

The only feature they provide is to have parenting that is not hierarchical.

Could just use group shapes and if they are on the top level, they could have this feature enabled.

title: Right click on composition in the document node tree -> show add layer menu
Please add /usr/include/ffmpeg and /usr/lib64 to FindLibav.cmake
description:
Please add /usr/include/ffmpeg to Libav_${comp_short}_INCLUDE_DIR search paths and /usr/lib64 to Libav_${comp_short}_LIBRARY search paths in cmake/modules/FindLibav.cmake.

Fedora-based distros use this paths for ffmpeg includes and for 64bit libraries.

Thank you.

Scaling issue
description:
#### Steps to reproduce

* open Glaxnimate
* load the appended file
* Go to Document > Resize
* try to resize document with either arrows or typing in a size (there might be different behaviour when appending a number to delting the contents of the textbox and writing in a new one)

#### Result

* the width for example does only go high to 703 and then flips back to 700 (I suppose it is rounding float values in the back, that is why I can do up to 3)
* I expected it to be able to go to my target resolution of 1280px

#### Version

```
Glaxnimate: 0.3.0-41-g998e16d
System: Windows 10 Version 2004
Kernel: winnt 10.0.19041
CPU: x86_64
```

title: New layer does not get a range of frames when made - properties shows 1st frame 0 and last frame -1
description:
A peculiar problem which I so far have just ignored because it was possible to set the frames in properties afterwards but when using a free form line this is impractical. Basically a new layer does not get a range of frames when made - properties shows 1st frame 0 and last frame -1 - so it is not visible. This can be changed in properties as mentioned. It happens in Glaxnimate: 0.5.2+appimage-757aea71 on Linux Mint 21.1 but in the stable version 0.5.1 it doesn't happen here a new layer is give a default range of 0 to 180 making it fully visible. Is there a setting/preference which needs to be set in the 0.5.2?

Glaxnimate: 0.5.2+appimage-757aea71
System: Linux Mint 21.1
Kernel: linux 5.15.0-60-generic
CPU: x86_64
Application Qt: 5.15.2
System Qt: 5.15.2

Potrace: potracelib 1.13
Libav: Lavu56.70.100, Lavf58.76.100, Lavc58.134.100, SwS5.9.100

title: app icon not showing in the gnome app grid when installed as flatpak
description:
Thanks for the great app!

There is a small issue regarding the app icon in the app drawer: is not shown when the app is installed as a flatpak at least on my machine.

I *think* it is because while the app icon itself is installed as `org.mattbas.Glaxnimate.svg`, the icon name referenced in the desktop file is `glaxnimate`. Changing it to `org.mattbas.Glaxnimate` fixes it. ( [flatpak documentation](https://docs.flatpak.org/en/latest/freedesktop-quick-reference.html) )

Import from Lottiefiles seems to be broken on Linux
description:
#### Steps to reproduce

<!-- Describe what you did (step-by-step) so we can reproduce: -->

* Open Glaxnimate
* Click on "File", then on "Import from LottieFiles"
* Search for "Let it snow"
* Click on second file top left, called "let it snow"
* Click on "Import" button

#### Result

Error message pops up:
![image](/uploads/57388829b1ca61733b73e82fa0ac8266/image.png)

#### Version

Glaxnimate: 0.5.1+flatpak-69-g56a4473f
System: Arch Linux
Kernel: linux 6.1.10-AMD-znver2
CPU: x86_64
Application Qt: 5.15.8
System Qt: 5.15.8
ZLib: 1.2.13
Potrace: potracelib 1.16
Libav: Lavu57.28.100, Lavf59.27.100, Lavc59.37.100, SwS6.7.100
libarchive: 3.6.2


<--------------------->
Additional information:

This is the glaxnimate-git package on Arch Linux. 
I have seen the same issue with the glaxnimate package. 
This issue is also present on every lottie file I have tried to import. 
Saving the file to disk and then importing it has the same results.

I don't have other operating systems to try on, so I don't know if it's related to my OS, some version of a package in my OS or anything. 
A few months ago Arch moved away from python2, and it's now depreciated, with python3 taking it's place. These two are not exactly compatible, so if you are using python scripts to handle the import this may be where the issue lies.

When reopening the project file giving the error - could not load first frame for Animation timing. Is there a maximum of timings you can set and I have exceeded the limit?

title: Show the contributors file in the about dialog
Deb package 0.5.1 fails to install on Debian 11 Bullseye due to libpython 3.10 requirement
description:
I noticed that the stable Deb package (version `0.5.1+deb-3a75daf1`) installation results in a broken package on Debian 11 Bullseye. This is due to the missing dependency on libpython 3.10. This cannot be satisfied in Debian 11 (which has Python 3.9, see https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/python3-defaults).

My workaround suggestion (in the absence of a second Deb package) is to specify this specific dependency in the [Deb section of the download page](https://glaxnimate.mattbas.org/download/#deb-package). Something like "requires Python 3.10".

Error 404 - Page Not Found

#### Additional information
https://glaxnimate.mattbas.org/download/ with https://gitlab.com/mattbas/glaxnimate/-/jobs/artifacts/release/raw/glaxnimate-src.tar.gz?job=tarball is *not* a viable alternative to this as it's missing any kind of version reference in either the url or the file name itself, e.g. we package 0.5.0, tarball gets updated and our 0.5.0 package starts to build 0.6.0 - you get the idea.

title: Text problem with size >49, and wrong Anchor Point position
description:
## Video Demonstration of the `Text Size` and `Anchor Point Placement` problems: Please see this [Demo Video](https://youtu.be/RVVwrAaY-XU) I recorded for explaining the following issues: *** ## If Font Size > 49 ### Steps to reproduce (1) * Open Glaxnimate * Add a Text Line with `Font Size > 49` #### Result The `Text Box` would become a small icon and may reside at the top-left corner of the screen *** ## Change the Font Size < 50 and see the Anchor Point ### Steps to reproduce (2) * Keep it selected and change the `Font Size < 50` #### Result * The Text Box will return to its normal shape. * Observe the `Anchor Point` may not be at the center of the Text Box, it might be at the top-left corner of the Screen or the Text box itself. * Click anywhere on the screen to deselect it and then select it back, but `Anchor Point` would not be at the center point of the Text Box. *** ## If Font Size < 50, See Anchor Point. ### Steps to reproduce (3) * Add another Text Line with `Text Size < 49` #### Result * Observe that Text Box would appear fine, however, its `Anchor Point` would reside on the top-left corner of the screen. * Click anywhere on the screen to deselect it. Now select it back and you would observe that the `Anchor Point` jumps back to the center of the Text Box. *** ### Version Glaxnimate: 0.5.0+win-49002eec

title: Control key does not constrain the line to 90°
description:
Greetings from NZ;

When drawing bezier lines, <kbd>**ctrl**</kbd> is supposed to snap the line to 90°, but for me this isn't working. I have tested on Linux using the built in version from Shotcut (version 0.5.0-53-g5972fc91) and the latest stable release on Windows 11.

Also confirmed via [this thread](https://forum.shotcut.org/t/animated-box-border-drawing-for-outlining-text-or-graphics/35034/14?u=poisonedslice) that lead Shotcut developer Dan, and several other knowledgeable members, have not been able to make this work either.

I didn't include this as a bug since the description is self explanatory and there is no trigger. I apologise if that was the wrong choice, and will amend if requested.

title: compile error on M_PI
description:
#### Steps to reproduce

Compile glaxnimate using msys2 on Windows with gcc 11.2 toolchain.

#### Result

Get the following error:
> error: 'M_PI' was not declared in this scope

Full build log [here](https://github.com/mltframework/shotcut/runs/6269890446?check_suite_focus=true).

#### Version

git master as of May 3, 2022.

#### More Info

`M_PI` is not in any C or C++ standard. It is commonly available, however:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Mathematical-Constants.html

That indirectly explains you need to define `_XOPEN_SOURCE` with gcc (and clang?). MSVC probably requires a different macro, but you might not be experiencing the problem there. In any case, I can workaround the problem by setting environment variable `CXXFLAGS-D_XOPEN_SOURCE=500` before the first run of cmake, which I will do as a workaround for now. (Edit `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` in `CMakeCache.txt` if you already ran cmake.) In my own code for these circumstances I put into a header file before `#include <math.h>` (or `<cmath>`?)
```
#if !defined(_XOPEN_SOURCE) || _XOPEN_SOURCE < 500
#  undef _XOPEN_SOURCE
#  define _XOPEN_SOURCE 500
#endif
```
I report as a bug instead of merge request and simply provide some tips to let you decide what to do if anything.

title: AUR packages doesn't follow Arch Linux standards
description:
The current stable version is called glaxnimate-git, this is not used for the source for the package but for the kind of version. -git means last dev CVS revision. -dev for development release versions.
https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Arch_User_Repository#What_is_the_difference_between_foo_and_foo-git_packages?

The current PKGBUILD used in glaxnimate-git should be put in a new AUR package glaxnimate. and glaxnimate-git should be adapted to get last git version and autoupdate name.

I adapted current PKGBUILD to the real -git mode if it can help, it will automatically update revision number in package.

[PKGBUILD](/uploads/d1a04a9bba1605e2de6cd9a4dc9d1370/PKGBUILD)

title: SVG conversion and alpha interpolation problem
description:
Here I have source json and destination animated SVG. There are two objects one jam (in red) and one bread slice.

In the original Glax format and json, the jam is hidden by putting it's alpha channel to 0. It is changed abruptly to 1 at the moment the bread reach the center of the picture. It use the ability to keep a state constant until a keyframe and then change it progressively, or change abruptly it's state.

[murphy_anim0.json](/uploads/fd7f15b5513c41b76cf3a68f7795d2b3/murphy_anim0.json)

With SVG conversion instead, the change from 0 to 1 is progressive, making the jam fade-in before the bread slice cover it.

[murphy_anim0.animated.svgz](/uploads/e12d9e1bcf7cb06728cdfc80adf0ed6f/murphy_anim0.animated.svgz)

An easy solution for the animator would be to have the jam object follow the bread, hidden behind it. But for conversion, a new nod near the changing state node could keep the 0 value to emulate Lottie feature.

There is a little glitch in the bottom corner of the bread in the SVG(z) version too, but it should probably be in another issue?
